interesting_fact: Nepal is home to Mount Everest, the highest mountain in the world.
Japan has more than 6,800 islands, with Honshu being the largest.
Canada has the longest coastline of any country in the world.
Australia is home to over 10,000 beaches—visiting one daily would take 27 years!
Brazil has the Amazon Rainforest, which produces 20% of the world’s oxygen.
The Eiffel Tower in Paris grows about 15 cm taller in summer due to heat expansion.
India is the world's largest democracy and the second-most populous country.
The Great Pyramid of Giza is the only remaining Wonder of the Ancient World.
Germany is home to over 20,000 castles, many of which are open to visitors.
South Africa has three capital cities: Pretoria (executive), Bloemfontein (judicial), and Cape Town (legislative).
China is home to the Great Wall, the longest wall in the world, stretching over 13,000 miles.
